pr_title: Mark new chunks ready before triggering OnChunkLoaded events.

timeline.message: Mark new chunks ready before triggering OnChunkLoaded events.

timeline.bodyText: You've moved the call to the worldEntity until after markReady, but what of the listener.onChunkReady before it? Should onChunkReady also be called only after the chunk is marked ready?
timeline.author: keturn

replies.bodyText: You're right. That also looks like it should be moved.
replies.author: 4Denthusiast

replies.bodyText: The only actual implementation of onChunkReady is in ServerImpl, and that does assume that the chunk can already be written to.
replies.author: 4Denthusiast

timeline.bodyText:
This one took a little more reading than RemoteChunkProvider because of the number of lines in this function, but I think I believe this. We should mark the chunk as ready before sending any of those events to blocks and entities in the chunk, or the loaded/generated events about the chunk itself.
That wouldn't be the case if something operating on that collection of event mappings is a precondition for chunk readiness -- but I don't see any evidence of that here. It just fires off a bunch of events, there are no conditions on any of them being handled any particular way.
timeline.author: keturn

replies.bodyText: Also, because this isn't in the main thread, the event handlers aren't guaranteed to run before the chunk is marked ready anyway (and they usually don't).
replies.author: 4Denthusiast

timeline.message: Run ChunkReadyListeners after the chunk is ready too.
